MLS is quickly becoming a league of a few teams with large fanbases and the rest with barely any fans. Atlanta, Seattle, Orlando, Portland, LA, Toronto, NYC, San Jose, and Kansas City prop the rest of the league up in regards to attendance and hype. The rest of the league usually gets piss poor attendance and has apathetic cities.
There is absolutely 0 reason why Columbus, Vancouver, and Salt Lake City shouldn't have huge followings. All of those cities have barely any pro competition and field competitive teams most every year. Dallas, Houston, Boston, philly, Red Bull's, Chicago, Denver, and Montreal all have more competition and can get lost in the shuffle, but that still doesn't excuse the apathetic nature of those cities.
